pkgmetadata.longdescription: Spatial Early Warning Signals of Ecosystem Degradation // Tools to compute and assess significance of early-warnings signals (EWS) of ecosystem degradation on raster data sets. EWS are metrics derived from the observed spatial structure of an ecosystem -- e.g. spatial autocorrelation -- that increase before an ecosystem undergoes a non-linear transition (Genin et al. (2018) doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13058).
